plugins.name: The One Ring
plugins.bigPicture: The org-wide governance layer. Company strategy and consistency is its primary mission — brand voice, HR policies, security standards, and core values are the individual facets that serve that mission. Every piece of content, every decision, and every process at Olytic runs through this layer. It is installed for all employees and cannot be disabled.
plugins.purpose: Without a single source of truth for what Olytic stands for, every piece of content and every decision risks drifting — in message, in values, or in policy compliance. The One Ring exists so that anyone using Claude at Olytic gets the same strategic grounding, the same brand voice, and the same governance guardrails applied automatically. It is the baseline that makes every other plugin coherent.

useCases.title: Audit a guest blog post against brand standards
useCases.description: Paste a draft blog post and run /brand-check. The plugin scores it against all five messaging pillars, flags hollow superlatives like 'best-in-class', and catches any sentence that could describe a generic consultancy instead of Olytic specifically.

useCases.title: Check whether a strategic decision aligns with current priorities
useCases.description: Describe a decision or action and run /strategy-check. It evaluates strategic fit (does this serve our current stage?), message alignment (does this differentiate us?), and values alignment (would we be proud of this at meeting #20?).

useCases.title: Run a full governance scan on a client proposal
useCases.description: Use the consistency-auditor agent before sending any high-stakes document. It covers all five facets: brand voice, strategy alignment, core values, HR norms, and security standards — and presents a summary scorecard before diving into detailed recommendations.

useCases.title: Orient a new team member on everything that matters
useCases.description: Run the onboarding-guide agent. It asks whether the person is full-time, a contractor, or returning — and calibrates its walkthrough accordingly. Covers what Olytic is (and isn't), where we are right now, core values in practice, communication norms, and key rules.

rulesets.name: Company Strategy & Core Values
rulesets.summary: Primary governance skill. Business stage: early-stage GTM, next goal is first client. All work serves one of three purposes: build credibility, create visibility, enable conversion. Five strategic priorities with status: website/content, offering definition, first client acquisition, delivery framework, internal tooling. Core Values: Clarity over noise, Embedded partnership, Amplification not automation, Systems thinking, Earned expertise. Engagement models: fixed-fee assessments and retainers — no hourly consulting, staff aug, or software licenses. O/G/O philosophy: 'amplification not automation' is an architectural principle, not a tagline.

rulesets.name: Brand Standards
rulesets.summary: Defines Olytic as a 'revenue systems firm' (not a consultancy, SaaS vendor, or agency). Enforces O/G/O as core positioning. ICP: SMB B2B with GTM teams, has RevOps manager but lacks tech strategy. Voice: expert and specific, opinionated, dry humor, structured (bullets/tables), 'we' positioning, mocks corporate-speak gently. Banned: hollow superlatives, text walls, emojis, salesy language, framing AI as replacing humans. Five messaging pillars: Systems not consulting, Amplification not automation, Closed-loop architecture, Embedded partnership, Revenue outcomes. Design: DM Sans font, Gold (#C8A96E) accent, warm off-white surfaces (#F7F7F5), near-black ink, clean flat layouts.

rulesets.name: HR Policies
rulesets.summary: Culture: expertise over activity, ownership over tasks, directness over diplomacy, continuous improvement. Communication: default async, structured (bullets/headers), respond within 24h, meetings need agendas, document decisions. Work: fully remote, async-first, no mandated core hours, client-facing roles align to client hours. PTO: unlimited/flexible with advance notice. Sick leave: take it when needed. Holidays: US federal + regional with notice. Onboarding: access setup, plugin install, read company-strategy + brand-standards + security-policies, onboarding call with leadership. Professional development: budget exists, learning is expected, share knowledge back to team.

rulesets.name: Security Policies
rulesets.summary: Four-tier data classification: Public (website/social, unrestricted), Internal (strategy/OKRs, Olytic-only), Confidential (client data/pricing, authorized only), Restricted (credentials/PII, encrypted, need-to-know). Client data: never expose without permission, anonymize all examples, don't store credentials in plugins. AI usage: never paste client data into public AI tools, always be the final quality gate (Governor principle). Credentials: never hardcode, use environment variables, rotate on team changes. Incident response: stop, document, notify leadership immediately — low bar for reporting.

triggerConditions.narrative: This plugin activates whenever your prompt touches company strategy, brand voice, core values, HR norms, or security rules. If Claude detects that the output will be external-facing content or references an internal policy or decision, The One Ring loads in the background. It stays out of the way for general-purpose tasks that have nothing to do with Olytic-specific context.

successCriteria.narrative: The One Ring succeeds when Olytic's brand voice, strategic alignment, and policies are applied consistently across all outputs without requiring manual correction. The primary signal is governance scan pass rate. Secondary signals are whether policy questions are answered accurately, whether strategic decisions consistently reflect current priorities, and whether onboarding orientation reduces ramp time for new contributors.

guardrails: Never write fluffy thought leadership. No 'rapidly evolving landscapes.'
Never position Olytic as a consulting firm or SaaS vendor.
Never suggest AI replaces humans. Always frame as amplification.
Never be salesy or pushy. Let the expertise speak.
Never expose client data or credentials in any output.

plugins.name: Content Strategist
plugins.bigPicture: Handles content operations end-to-end: deciding what to write, producing it, pushing it to GitHub, and measuring how it performed. It reads from GA4 (Property 525690219), pulls and pushes to the olytic-site repo, and applies the Content O/G/O loop (draft, review against brand standards, optimize from analytics). Requires The One Ring for brand voice.
plugins.purpose: Content is Olytic's primary credibility and visibility engine at this stage. This plugin exists to close the gap between 'we should publish more' and actually doing it. It codifies what to write (strategy), how to write it (templates and brand rules), where to publish it (GitHub repos), and whether it worked (GA4). Without it, content production stalls or goes off-strategy.

useCases.title: Write a blog post about Salesforce CPQ amendments, push it to GitHub
useCases.description: Say 'write a blog post about managing amendments in Salesforce CPQ.' The website-content skill loads the HTML template structure, the brand-standards skill (from The One Ring) sets the voice, and the content-strategy skill confirms this maps to the Revenue Systems Expertise pillar. When done, /push-content stages it on a feature branch in olytic-site.

useCases.title: Pull the homepage, audit it, and push a revised version
useCases.description: Run /pull-content to fetch index.html from the olytic-site repo. Run /brand-check to score it. Edit the sections that scored 'Needs Work.' Run /push-content to push the updated version to a feature branch for review.

useCases.title: Ask 'What should we write next?' and get a prioritized recommendation
useCases.description: The content-strategist agent evaluates your current content against the ICP journey (Awareness, Consideration, Decision), scores topic candidates on ICP Pain, Differentiation, Search Potential, Stage Coverage, and First Client Impact, then recommends the highest-value piece to create next.

useCases.title: Analyze which blog posts are driving traffic and which are dead weight
useCases.description: Run /content-performance. It pulls GA4 data (pageviews, time on page, scroll depth, conversions) and maps each page to its strategic purpose (credibility, visibility, conversion). You get a clear picture of what's working and what to rewrite or retire.

rulesets.name: Content Strategy
rulesets.summary: Three content pillars mapped to Olytic's three uniques: Revenue Systems Expertise (CPQ, RevOps, Salesforce), The Olytic Model (O/G/O in practice), Strategic Value Creation (AI strategy for GTM). ICP content journey: Awareness (educate via blog posts) → Consideration (differentiate via comparisons and deep-dives) → Decision (convert via landing pages and assessment offers). Prioritization scoring: ICP Pain (high), Differentiation (high), Search Potential (medium), Stage Coverage (medium), First Client Impact (high). Content O/G/O loop: Operator drafts, Governor reviews via /brand-check, Optimizer analyzes via GA4. Target cadence: 2 blog posts/month, 1 landing page/month.

rulesets.name: Website Content
rulesets.summary: Blog post structure: specific expert-level title, subtitle, TOC for 4+ sections, H2 per distinct idea, bullet-heavy body, structured scenario formats, subtle CTA. Length: 1,500-3,000 words. Landing page structure: hero with outcome headline + single CTA, problem bullets in ICP language, solution referencing O/G/O, 3-step 'how it works', comparison table, social proof, repeated CTA. HTML rules: semantic elements, <strong> for scannability, <table> for comparisons, meta description for ICP search intent. SEO: long-tail keywords ('AI for revenue operations', 'RevOps AI strategy for SMBs'), keyword in H1 and first paragraph, no stuffing.

triggerConditions.narrative: This plugin activates when your prompt involves creating, editing, publishing, or measuring website content. Any mention of blog posts, landing pages, pulling or pushing to the site repo, content planning, or performance analytics will load the relevant skills. It does not activate for governance questions, plugin creation, or general development tasks.

plugins.name: Plugin Creator
plugins.bigPicture: Builds new plugins and manages the Olytic marketplace. Runs a 7-question discovery to gather requirements, generates all plugin files (skills, commands, agents, hooks, MCP configs), injects telemetry into every output, and stages marketplace updates on feature branches. Works for both internal Olytic plugins and client-facing ones.
plugins.purpose: Olytic's plugin architecture only scales if building new plugins is fast and consistent. This plugin exists to turn a set of requirements into a fully structured, telemetry-equipped plugin in one session instead of a week of manual file creation. It also manages the marketplace so that new plugins are discoverable and versioned from day one.

useCases.title: Build a 'Sales Enablement' plugin for the sales team from scratch
useCases.description: Run /create-plugin. The 7-question discovery asks: plugin name, purpose, target users, strategic questions, constraints, integrations needed, and success metrics. From those answers, the plugin-builder agent generates the full file structure: skills, commands, agents, plugin.json manifest, and a telemetry skill. You review and ship.

useCases.title: Add a new plugin to the Olytic marketplace after building it
useCases.description: Run /update-marketplace with the plugin directory. It reads the current marketplace.json, diffs the changes, generates an updated entry, and pushes everything to a feature branch in olytic-plugins for review. The catalog page auto-updates when the PR is merged.

useCases.title: Generate a client-facing plugin with embedded telemetry
useCases.description: Every plugin generated by this tool automatically includes a telemetry skill that logs usage events, version tags, constraint violations, and user feedback. This is not optional. The telemetry skill is injected into the output regardless of whether you ask for it.

rulesets.name: Plugin Discovery
rulesets.summary: Seven-question dynamic protocol that adapts based on answers. Questions cover: plugin name and one-liner, primary purpose, target user roles, strategic questions about the domain, operational constraints, required integrations (MCP servers, APIs), and success/quality metrics. Output is a structured requirements document that feeds into the generation phase.

rulesets.name: Plugin Generation
rulesets.summary: Generates all plugin files from discovery output using reference templates for every component type (skills, commands, agents, hooks, MCP configs). Follows Olytic's agentic best practices: verification gates after every write, progressive disclosure in skills, clear frontmatter with trigger descriptions, and structured agent definitions with tool restrictions. Every generated plugin includes auto-injected telemetry.

rulesets.name: Marketplace Management
rulesets.summary: Reads the current marketplace.json from SupportOlyticSolutions/olytic-plugins, diffs proposed changes, and stages updates on feature branches. Manages catalog.json entries for the dynamic plugin catalog page. Never auto-merges to main. All changes go through human review.

It does not activate for content creation, brand compliance, or strategy questions handled by other plugins.

successCriteria.narrative: The Plugin Creator succeeds when new plugins are shipped quickly, are structurally consistent with existing ones, and get actively used after delivery. A plugin that sits unused after creation is a failure regardless of how well it was built. Telemetry is the primary feedback loop: every generated plugin includes a telemetry skill that logs usage, so adoption is measurable from day one.

kpis.metric: Time from requirements to delivered plugin
kpis.target: Under 2 hours for a standard plugin with 2-3 skills and 1-2 commands
kpis.reporting: Logged manually at delivery. Timestamp from /create-plugin invocation to PR opened in olytic-plugins.

kpis.target: 100% of generated plugins pass the plugin-builder verification gates without manual fixes
kpis.reporting: Verification gate output is included in the delivery summary. Any manual fixes are noted in the PR description.

kpis.target: At least one active user logging telemetry events within 2 weeks of delivery
kpis.reporting: Telemetry skill logs reviewed via the olytic-lab repo or designated telemetry dashboard. Reviewed per plugin at the 2-week mark.

kpis.target: catalog.json reflects all active plugins within 24 hours of delivery
kpis.reporting: GitHub commit history on olytic-plugins. /update-marketplace should be run as the final step of every plugin delivery.

guardrails: Every generated plugin includes a telemetry skill. No exceptions.
Telemetry logs: usage events, version tags, constraint violations, user feedback.
Marketplace changes are staged on feature branches. Never auto-merged.
Verification gates run after every write operation. No silent failures.
No hallucination: if a file or data point isn't found, report 'Not Found' immediately.
Permission gates: confirm with user before destructive actions or 5+ simultaneous changes.
